title: How Many Calories Are in a Shot of Vodka?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a shot of vodka—about 96 kcal—with full nutrition breakdown, equivalents, and tweaks for different proofs.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Shot of Vodka?
assumptions: Standard 1.5 fl oz (44 ml) serving of 80-proof (40% ABV) plain vodka, distilled from grains.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, proof, distillation process, and serving size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard shot of 80-proof vodka contains about 96 calories, all from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a standard shot of vodka?
faqs.a: About 96 kcal for a 1.5 oz shot of 80-proof vodka.

faqs.q: Does vodka have carbs or sugar?
faqs.a: Plain vodka has 0 g carbs and 0 g sugars; calories come solely from alcohol.

faqs.q: How does proof affect calories in vodka?
faqs.a: Higher proof means more alcohol and calories—e.g., 100-proof adds ~24 kcal per shot.

faqs.q: Are there any nutrients in a shot of vodka besides calories?
faqs.a: No protein, fat, fiber, or significant vitamins; trace sodium only.

faqs.q: What about calories in flavored vodka shots?
faqs.a: Flavored varieties add 30–70 kcal from sugars, totaling 126–166 kcal per shot.
